intro: Coussapoa jatun-sachensis, commonly known as the Andean candlewood, is a flowering plant native to the high Andes of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in cool, moist environments at high altitudes. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
